intro: Launaea cabrae subsp. nanella, commonly known as the narrowleaf launaea, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clustered heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, storing moisture in its fleshy stems. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
